org.apache.river.test.spec.jeri.util

Class FakeInvocationHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.river.test.spec.jeri.util.FakeInvocationHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InvocationHandler

    public class FakeInvocationHandler
extends Object
implements InvocationHandler
    A fake InvocationHandler that can be configured to throw an exception or verify method parameters and return a result.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FakeInvocationHandler

        public FakeInvocationHandler()
        Constructs a FakeInvocationHandler.

      • FakeInvocationHandler

        public FakeInvocationHandler(Throwable ie,
                             Method em,
                             Object[] ea,
                             Object ro)
        Constructs a FakeInvocationHandler.
        Parameters:
        ie - the exception that the invoke method must throw if not null
        em - the Method that the invoke method should be called with; a check is made to ensure that they are .equals if not null
        ea - the Object array that the invoke method should be called with; a check is made to ensure that each element is .equals if not null
        ro - the return value that the invoke method must return if ie is not null

        Initializes (or re-initializes) a FakeInvocationHandler.
        Parameters:

        em - the Method that the invoke method should be called with; a check is made to ensure that they are .equals if not null
        ea - the Object array that the invoke method should be called with; a check is made to ensure that each element is .equals if not null
        ro - the return value that the invoke method must return if ie is not null

        public Object invoke(Object proxy,
                     Method method,
                     Object[] args)
              throws Throwable
        Implementation of interface method. Throws an exception or verifies that method parameters are correct.
        Specified by:
